intro: Angelica breweri, commonly known as the Chihuahuan Angelica, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, slender stem and large, compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open grasslands. Angelica breweri is valued for its medicinal properties and is also an important plant for pollinators in its native habitat.
